page.title: 03AGRICULTURE, HADLEIGH (CONT)
page.content: In one field the farmer was using a scare gun.It worked on calor gas and every ten minutes it gave a loud bang to scare the birds away from the young crops. The signs for footpaths were difficult to find.In some fields the farmers had planted his crops across them and we had to walk along the edge of the field or in the tractor tracks. When we were walking past an oil-seed rape field we saw some gun cartridges. That told us that people went shooting there,probably for partridges and pheasants. As we walked around the fields we saw trees with very thick trunks which had been pollarded.This means that before the branches could grow they had been cut off and used for poles,fences and firewood.It showed us that the people in this area used and needed wood.
